Hi,

i used invokeMethod() of PreviligedAccesor class given in JUNIT FAQs. 
But its working for private methods only (not for static private
methods).Any alternative other than this.


Thanks and Regards
Vara Prasad



--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "oswalvivek" <v.oswal@p...> wrote:
> Agreed. However, If you still need this :) , you could look up junit 
> faqs. They've demonstrated this technique with a 
> PrivilegedAccessorTest, the target class is PrivilegedAccessor.
> 
> Cheers,
> Vivek
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Elliotte Rusty Harold <elharo@m...> 
> wrote:
> > Prasad wrote:
> > > hi everybody,
> > >
> > > Iam new to JUnit.I have to test a static private function. 
> > >   
> > 
> > 
> > No you don't. You either need to test the public methods that call 
> the 
> > private static function or you need to delete the function if 
> nothing in 
> > the public (or protected) interfaces call it.
> > 
> > 
> > --
> > Elliotte Rusty Harold
